name: Roselle Juice Recipe (น้ำกระเจี๊ยบ)
description: This roselle juice recipe is easy to make using fresh or dried flowers. It's a drink that's perfect for summer!

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the fresh roselle flowers and take out all the seeds.
recipeInstructions.name: Wash the fresh roselle flowers and take out all the seeds.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat water in a pot over medium heat until it boils, then add the flowers. Let them simmer for 15 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat water in a pot over medium heat until it boils, then add the flowers. Let them simmer for 15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Take the flowers out of the pot. Mix in salt and sugar with the juice until the sugar has dissolved, then turn off the heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Take the flowers out of the pot. Mix in salt and sugar with the juice until the sugar has dissolved, then turn off the heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Chill your glass in the fridge before serving to cool it. To serve, fill a tall glass with cubed or crushed ice and then pour in the drink.

review.reviewBody:
Aloha from Hawai'i.  Thanks for this recipe for our fresh roselle flowers:  so delicious!

For readers without access to either living plants or Asian grocery stores, dried roselle flowers can also be found in Hispanic groceries and sometimes in the Hispanic aisle of common mega-markets. They're usually labeled as "hibiscus flowers" or "flor de jamaica" and are found either with the dried chiles or in the spice aisle.  They're great for Agua de Jamaica, too.  Thank you for sharing your beautiful recipes!
